/**
 * Populates the set of field screen tabs with the tabs which contain errors. This is based on the error collection
 * supplied, which is a mapping from field names to error messages. Will return the index of the tab to be selected,

 * @param errors              the error collection
 * @param fieldScreenRenderer the field screen renderer to resolve {@link FieldScreenRenderTab} from field ids.
 * @param webParameters       the Webwork parameters
 * @return the (1-based) index of the tab to be selected.
 */
public int initialiseTabsWithErrors(final SortedSet<FieldScreenRenderTab> tabsWithErrors, final Map<String, ?> errors, final FieldScreenRenderer fieldScreenRenderer, final Map webParameters) {
    if (errors != null && !errors.isEmpty()) {
        // Record the tabs which have fields with errors on them
        for (String fieldId : errors.keySet()) {
            // some code here
        }

        // Add 1 as the status' counts in WW iterators start at 1 (not 0)
        return tabsWithErrors.first().getPosition() + 1; //line 60
    } else {
        return 1;
    }
}
{code}

fields.description:
Currently when a plugin is installed in one of the nodes in the Data center, the UpmAsynchronousTaskManager installs the plugin in that node, and the ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread installs the plugin in the other nodes after receiving a cluster message. In a certain scenario, which could not be replicated, the previous plugin version seems to be retained and manifests itself after a restart. Below the audit log indicates successful installation of the plugin version 2.6.2.26202114 over 2.6.2.26202123 for a patch on Sep 6th around 17:42pm. (upm displays the date/time 9.5 hours ahead, since it was performed in a different TZ)
 !zephyr_patch_audit_log.jpg!

Looking at the application log, the plugin installation seems to be successful and the node reports successful enabling of the plugin corresponding to the UPM screenshot above, but does not indicate the plugin version being installed
h3. Installing node Node1
{code:java}
2018-09-06 17:39:22,648 UpmAsynchronousTaskManager:thread-3 INFO pr94358 1059x223928x1 97tz4 169.177.209.49,169.177.226.126 /rest/plugins/1.0/ [atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler] Plugin 'com.thed.zephyr.je' is now ENABLED
{code}
h3. Propagation to Node2
{code:java}
2018-09-06 17:42:08,799 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler] Plugin 'com.thed.zephyr.je' is now ENABLED
{code}
h3. Propagation to Node3
{code:java}
2018-09-06 17:42:05,972 ClusterMessageHandlerServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [atlassian.plugin.manager.PluginEnabler] Plugin 'com.thed.zephyr.je' is now ENABLED
{code}
But the subsequent restarts show the previous version of plugin 2.6.2.26202123 to be installed as seen in the subsequent restart messages below on Sept 8th. This required us to re-install the 2.6.2.26202114 plugin on Sept10th as seen in the above upm screenshot where it tries to uninstall 2.6.2.26202123, which should have been uninstalled on 6th September itself.

Log messages on all the nodes after the restart on 8th shows plugin 2.6.2.26202123 to be available.
{code:java}
------Node1-----
2018-09-08 19:23:06,321 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger]

Zephyr for JIRA : com.thed.zephyr.je
 Version : 2.6.2.26202123
 Status : enabled
------Node2------
 2018-09-08 19:23:24,205 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger]

Zephyr for JIRA : com.thed.zephyr.je
 Version : 2.6.2.26202123
 Status : enabled
------Node3-------
2018-09-08 19:23:33,605 localhost-startStop-1 INFO [atlassian.jira.startup.JiraStartupLogger]

Zephyr for JIRA : com.thed.zephyr.je
 Version : 2.6.2.26202123
 Status : enabled
------------------{code}

It would be easier to track the plugin that is currently being enabled, if the version of the plugin is provided in the logs not only after startup but also during enabling it.
fields.summary: In Jira DC logs should indicate version of plugin being installed and enabled

fields.description:
Hi Team

GBDS Jira server installed and configured with below versions, its installed in a single bundle

JIRA Service Desk 3.4.0
 JIRA Software 7.3.1
 JIRA Core 7.3.3

Now we are upgrading with latest versions, we tested with below software's as per this link ([https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/try])

1. Jira Service Desk (atlassian-jira-servicedesk-3.15.1-standalone)
  In this case after installing we are able to see latest version SD and after replacing home directory with old data, we are able to see all software,SD,core but here its replacing with old server version for "software"

2. Jira Service Desk + Jira software (atlassian-jira-servicedesk-3.15.1-standalone)
  In this case after installing we are able to see latest versions for both and after replacing home directory with old data, here its replacing "software" version with old server version.
  
 3. Jira software (atlassian-jira-software-7.12.1.tar.gz)
  In this case after installing we are able to see latest version Software and after replacing home directory with old data, we are able to see all software,SD,core but here its replacing with old server version for "SD"
  
 Please advise how to upgrade jira (software + Service Desk ) with a single bundle.

Regards,
 Venkat.
fields.summary: Upgrade JIRA -software and Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The issue field associated with Linked Issues of the Issue Linking system field in JIRA is always empty on the edit screen even though there are issues linked to the issue being edited:
!Selection_452.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA issue in any project and link it to any other issue with any link type.
# Confirm from the issue view that there is/are linked issues.
# Click the edit button to popup the edit screen, then take a look at the Linked Issues fields on the edit screen.

h3. Expected Results
* On the edit screen, when you select the correct link type, the issues field should show all the linked issues for that link type.
* You should be able to edit/remove linked issues from the linked issues field on an edit screen.

h3. Actual Results
* When you select any of the link types, none of the linked issues are displayed
* Since you can't see linked issues on the edit, you can't remove them on this screen either.
 
h3.Workaround
You can still remove linked issues inline from the issue view screen (only edit screen is affected in this bug)
fields.summary: Linked issues issue picker is always empty on edit screen even when there are linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When installing a new Jira as a service, installer won't install the service successfully if there's a service that's disabled lying around.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software 7.12.2 and Windows Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Install Jira as a Service on top of an existing active service and an old disabled service.

h3. Expected Results
Service installs correctly
h3. Actual Results
Installing (even installing manually too) does not install the service even manually installing says that it was successful.

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Remove the old disabled service and install the service again.
fields.summary: Installer unable to create Windows Service when there's an old disabled Service installed in Windows

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Currently running reports again Jira will add extra load and may overload the system.
* Also in many cases, it's not required to have real-time reports and it's enough to have reports delayed for a couple of hours, that means a SQL replica can be used. 
* Jira doesn't allow to operated in RO mode, so that prevents from using SQL replica 

h3. Suggested Solution
* Create a special Jira mode (build) which will allow reporting to be done from SQL RO replica
* Optimize REST API for reporting purposes. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Run a separate node in DC
fields.summary: As a Jira Administrator I want to have a reporting Read only node

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:
At the moment, it appears that if we logging out from JIRA Data Center through the "Log Out" option from the avatar, it does not completely log out the user from the instance including the application that is connected to the same IdP. It appears that while the session on JIRA side is invalidated, it is not on IdP side so everytime the user is accessing JDC again, it will automatically be logged in.

h3. Suggested Solution:
Several suggestions that could improve the logging out behavior will be:
# For JIRA/SAML plugin to tell the IdP to invalidate the user/client session completely.
# Removing the "Log Out" option when Data Center is integrated with SAML so it forces the user/client to log out from the IdP itself.
# To redirect the user to the IdP "Log Out" page when clicking the same option from JIRA, Confluence, etc.
fields.summary: Data Center SAML Log out improvement

fields.description:
h4. Summary

In large data center environment (for example, Jira has over 1 million issues), background reindex was generating load and putting pressure on GC by generating objects and then releasing them after. On top of that, user activities add more load to the system. User might experience performance issue CPU spike and some significant impact. 

h4. Documentation

We have mentioned the background reindex impact in [Jira Indexing FAQ|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-indexing-faq-776654790.html]
{quote}
Background reindexing uses just a single thread and in theory should trundle along in the background without significant impact on the rest of JIRA. In some circumstances though it may have a significant impact. On large systems under heavy load with a high rate of issue searches then there may be some significant impact, and it may be wise to perform the re-index during a period of lower activity, e.g. in the middle of the night
{quote}

h4. Suggestion

It would be nice to add some notification or warning message in the index page in JIra's UI indicate the impact for large data center environment.
fields.summary: Add background reindex warning for large data center environment

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

JIRA CSV import which contains attachments will cause the attachment files to corrupt. The file was copied to the correct directory and path and we are able to download it. However, it is not able to open it. This is caused by the URLs in the CSV export from the source system pointing to *secure* resources. So, when the target system runs a CSV import and tries to load the attachments via HTTP, it is redirected to the login page. The CSV importer follows the redirect and grabs the HTML content payload, and saves the attachment file with correct name, but with contents being HTML payload of the login page.
h3. *Environment*

JIRA Version: 7.6.2
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*

(i) We will be using PPTX files as an example, it impacting image file, CSV, XML, Excel (all files types). We are exporting and importing CSV from same instance.
 # Create a new Project and Issue
 # Upload a PPTX slides attachment
 # Use JQL to search for the issue and export all as CSV
 # The CSV shall contain attachment field as well
 # Create another new project and import the CSV files
 # Once CSV import succeeds, access to the imported issue and download the PPTX file
 # Open it with Power Point and it will show error
{code:java}
PowerPoint found a problem with content in xxxx.ppt__PowerPoint can attempt to repair the presentation.__If you trust the source of this presentation, click repair.__There was an error accessing the file xxxxx.ppt
{code}
(i) It seems this import creating new files directory and a file for the newly imported attachment instead of reffering to old attachment directory.

h3. *Expected Results*

We should be able to open the attachment file after the import
h3. *Actual Results*

Attachments are corrupted.
h3. Work Around

To work around this, you will need to give 'anonymous' access to the source project so that the import can download the necessary images. You can do this by
 # Go to the source project, and Project Settings > Permissions
 # Click Actions > Edit Permissions
 # Click Edit next to Browse Projects 
 # Click the Group radio button, and then select 'Anyone on the web'. 
 # Click Grant. 

(!) WARNING: This gives public access to the project to anyone on the web, and can create a security risk, so do this at your own risk. Once the import is done, remove the 'anyone on the web' permission from Browse Projects. 

Alternatively, you can download and copy the image files into <jira-home>/import folder on the server and import using the [file://|file:///] format in the CSV.
fields.summary: Attachments are broken when imported via a CSV import

fields.description:
h3. How to Replicate
 * Open any ticket in GSAC (as it's currently running 7.6.8)
 * Click on "More" button, then "Link"
 * Click on "Web Link" from the left hand side
 * You'll find two text boxes and a RTE textarea.
 * You won't be able to drag the URL field into the Link Text field
 * You won't be able to drag the URL field into the comment field unless the RTE is set to Visual (as opposed to Text)
 * The steps above will work fine (fields are completely drag-and-droppable) in version 7.2.9 instead.

h3. Instance Details

The above procedure will work out of the box in 7.2.9, and will not work out of the box in 7.6.8. No need for any customisation.
h3. Investigation Done
 * I've investigated the codebase and I think this problem has been introduced in commit 32f0dc44655078bf73831aff135131f854376bac, but that still needs confirming.
 * I've found various similar open tickets in GSAC and in the community support platform - all are hinting at a change in early Jira 7.3 to introduce a new RTE.

h3. Notes

The commit included is mostly JS code and with more than 400 insertions and 300 deletions (as it included a lot of splitting files and refactoring), so I wasn't able to pinpoint the exact spot where the functionality was lost (assuming it was lost within that commit)
fields.summary: Field drag and drop functionality no longer working on Jira past v7.2.9

fields.description:
*Issue:*
 When creating a support.zip in JIRA DC one or some of the nodes may report an error :

*Expected Behavior:*
 JIRA would create the support.zip properly and not try to add data that is greater than 255 characters

*Actual Behavior:*
 JIRA errors out due to data being too long for the column ( in most cases serialized_warnings is the culprit)

*In the logs you may see:*
{code:java}
Caused by: com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlDataTruncation: Data truncation: Data too long for column 'SERIALIZED_WARNINGS' which occurs when a file is too big to be added to the support.zip 
{code}
*Workaround:*
 (!) Always backup database before performing alterations and make sure to test the steps in a dev or stage environment first.(!)
 * stop JIRA
 * drop the affected column
 * re add affected column with varchar(400)
 * restart JIRA

(i) Please be aware that varchar(400) might not be long enough for all environment.
fields.summary: Support zip failing to complete for Data Center "data too long" error in logs

fields.description:
h4. Symptoms

Due to a code timeout, the Audit Log page (*System -> Troubleshooting and Support -> Audit Log*) is not able to render requests if the processing time on server side takes more than 25 seconds. It will fail with a message stating "There was an error loading data".

h4. Steps to Reproduce

You can either:
* Generate XX million rows of audit log data (audit_log table), that would significantly increase the database processing time and reduce the page response to above 25 seconds.
* Load into the audit_log table a couple of million rows into a database instance running on a server with few resources, the low processing capacity should provide very long response time.

Then attempt to search for a specific string.

h4. Suggestion
Create a feature making these timeouts customisable.

h4. Workaround

* Customize your search, for example, narrow it down to a shorter period using the date filter;
* Export the data outside browser using curl
** <JIRA_URL>/rest/jira-auditing-plugin/1/view?count=1&page=1&filter=XXXXXXXX
* Truncate the audit_log table to fewer rows;
* Move (archive) events to another database/table so they won't increase the time of search request;
* Increase your database server capacity to reduce processing time.
fields.summary: Audit log filter results in "There was an error loading data" error message

fields.description:
Jira upgrades may result in schema changes.  At times, these schema changes can take an extremely long time.

For example, MySQL can take an extremely long time to add a new column to tables with large amounts of data:
* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/24660456/mysql-performance-of-adding-a-column-to-a-large-table

h2. Real Situation
* Customer upgrading from 7.2.x to 7.6.x
* During startup of 7.6.x, Jira detects that the schema needs to be updated:
{code}
2018-08-21 21:48:18,340 localhost-startStop-1 WARN [o.o.c.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Field "updated" of entity "CustomFieldValue" is missing its corresponding column "UPDATED"
{code}
* At this point there is no more messaging and Jira appears to be stuck
* In this case, the customer has over 10 million entries in the {{customfieldvalue}} table and MySQL was taking over 45min. to complete the ALTER statement.

h5. Notes
Enabling SQL logging in Jira did not capture any information about what SQL query was run to perform the schema changes.


h2. Request
It'd be nice to have the ability to show that this schema change is still in progress and also a way to see what change SQL command is being run.
fields.summary: Better Messaging on Schema Changes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition:

Data Center customers have an expectation of availability for their server instances. Often in these large data center environments, users are programmatically created or provisioned from directory systems. However, when the license count is exceeded, users can still continually be created. This is a problem, because once the license count is exceeded the server becomes Read-Only and is no longer available for any real use. This action negates the feature of high availability, since no work can be done on it.
h3. Suggested Solution:

No longer allow the creation of any new users that exceed the license limit, and keep the server from being made Read-Only.
h3. Why this is needed:

Keeping the license count from being exceeded in order to maintain high availability of the server for all existing users requires constant vigilance for some teams.
fields.summary: Exceeding license limit should not render the server Read-Only for Data Center

h4. Problem 
Support for using *os_username* and *os_password* to authenticate when used as url query parameters has been deprecated in Jira 8.0.0. 

It is possible to disable support for *os_username & os_password* as url query parameters for authentication by setting  {{allowUrlParameterValue}} to _false_ in _<JIRA_install>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/web.xml_ .
example: 
{code:XML|borderStyle=solid}
    <filter>
        <filter-name>login</filter-name>
        <filter-class>com.atlassian.jira.web.filters.JiraLoginFilter</filter-class>
        <init-param>
            <param-name>allowUrlParameterValue</param-name>
            <param-value>false</param-value>
        </init-param>
    </filter>
{code}
fields.summary: Deprecate support for authenticating using os_username, os_password as url query parameters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira REST API returns '204 NO CONTENT' that includes content-type.

h3. Environment
* Tested with Jira 7.3.1 and 7.11.1.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Run the following CURL command to update custom field in JIRA:
{code}
curl -D- -u username:'password' -X PUT --data '{"fields":{"customfield_10501":123}}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" http://localhost/rest/api/2/issue/ABC-123
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Jira returns '204 NO CONTENT' without any content-type. As per documented in :

[RFC 2616 \- Hypertext Transfer Protocol \-\- HTTP/1.1-Section-4.3|https://tools.ietf.org/search/rfc2616#section-4.3]
{quote}
Any HTTP/1.1 message containing an entity-body SHOULD include a Content-Type header field defining the media type of that body
{quote}

[RFC 2616 \- Hypertext Transfer Protocol \-\- HTTP/1.1 - Section-7.2|https://tools.ietf.org/search/rfc2616#section-7.2]
{quote}
 An entity-body is only present in a message when a message-body is present
{quote}

Since Jira return 204 NO CONTENT for issue updated via REST API
{quote}
*204 NO CONTENT* HTTP code - The server has successfully fulfilled the request and that there is no additional content to send in the response payload body. 
{quote} 
Jira should not add a content-type to the response since no content is sent from the server.

h3. Actual Results
Jira REST API returns a content-type as below:
 !amirul@DESKTOP-SFSTQ3V_ ~ 2018-09-21 10.32.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
* Some library such as  IBM's Axis library will wait for the body content if the Content-Type is detected. Since 204 code did not have a body to return, the library will wait until it timeout before it resumed operation.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Jira REST API returns '204 NO CONTENT' that includes content-type

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JQL search panel is missing when viewing custom filter.
h3. Symptoms

{{<Jira>/rest/api/2/filter/favourite?expand=subscriptions[-5:]}} endpoint responds with http code 400
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Install Jira 7.12.2
 # Create sample project
 # Save filter with any JQL
 # Go to saved filter

h4. Expected result

Page shows JQL on top of the issue list and issue view
h4. Actual result

JQL panel is missing.
 !Screen Shot 2018-09-20 at 17.43.53.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # Open configuration file server.xml (should be in conf directory)
 # Find all connectors your application is using
 # Add {{relaxedPathChars="[]|" relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"}} to properties for example: 
{code:java}
<Connector port="8080" relaxedPathChars="[]|" relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" connectionTimeout="20000" enableLookups="false" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" protocol="HTTP/1.1" useBodyEncodingForURI="true" redirectPort="8443" acceptCount="100" disableUploadTimeout="true" bindOnInit="false"/>{code}
 # Restart Jira
See KB for full details: [changing server.xml to handle requests with special characters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-server-xml-to-handle-requests-with-special-characters-958453799.html]

(!) If you have multiple connectors in Jira, add the new parameters to each connector.

h3. Notes

Cause of the issue is new version of Tomcat (8.5.32) which was updated in 7.12.2.
fields.summary: JQL search panel is missing when viewing saved filter due to missing Tomcat parameters

fields.description:
h4. Summary
A receiver will not receive any email notification after enabling the "-Datlassian.mail.senddisabled=true" flag, but a mail will still be generated and placed in the mail queue. In large instance, mail queue and heap could get filled up, could lead to Jira not responding. 


h4. Improvements
When mail send is disabled via "-Datlassian.mail.senddisabled=true", Jira should not place any item in the mail queue. 

h4. Workaround
You can remove SMTP server from config to prevent items from being added to the queue.
fields.summary: JIRA should not add any item to mail queue when mail send is disabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When user creates an Incoming Mail handler they are able to specify the issue type as sub-task. They are not given the option to set the parent on this sub-task.

h3. Environment
Jira Core


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Administration > System*
# Choose *Incoming Mail* from left hand navigation
# Choose *Add incoming mail handler*
# Choose *Create a new issue or add and issue to an existing issue*
# Choose project
# Set issue type to *Sub-task*
# Fill other fields as necessary (defaults should be fine)
# Save handler and send email to project email address
# Sub-task will be created with no parent

h3. Expected Results
Sub-task should not be created without asking for parent

h3. Actual Results
No error is throw but new subtask will be created in project specified in handler
 
h3. Notes
This creates an orphaned subtask

h3.Workaround
No
fields.summary: Users able to create subtask with no parent via Jira mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Summary

IssuePermissionException is shown on the UI when deleting sub-task.
This problem happens in case security level is set on a specific way. Please see the following steps for the detail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a single user custom field and associate it to screens of the target project
# Create an issue security scheme
# Create a security level in the issue security scheme
#- Make the security level to use the custom field which you created in Step 1
# Configure the project to use the issue security scheme
# Create an issue in the project
#- Set the security level to the one you created in Step 3
#- Set the user custom field to the current login user
# Create a sub-task under the issue you created in Step 6
#- The security level is inherited from the parent
#- Set the user custom field to the current login user as you did in the parent issue
# Navigate back to the parent issue and delete the sub-task from _Sub-Tasks > ... > Delete_
 !Picture1.png|thumbnail! 
(i) Please don't delete the sub-task from _More > Delete_ in the page of the sub-task itself

h3. Expected Results

Sub-task should be deleted without any error.

h3. Actual Results

{{IssuePermissionException}} is shown even though the sub-task is actually deleted.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
If you reload the page on your browser, you can confirm that the sub-task was deleted.

h3.Workaround

Delete the sub-task from _More > Delete_ in the page of the sub-task itself.
fields.summary: IssuePermissionException is shown when deleting sub-task

fields.description:
With Microsoft expanding their functionality with Azure Active Directory and Crowd supporting a sync, we would like to have Azure Active Directory support withing Jira Server/Software.  This would greatly help our world-wide efforts within our company. 

Primarily we want to ensure users are de-provisioned when they are inactivated/expired/deleted from our Azure account or from a B2B company within Azure.  The only way to ensure this is to have a sync as JIT (just in time) provisioning of users requires the user to authenticate and login before any updates are done from the authentication token.  We would like this to be more proactive via a sync.
fields.summary: Provide support for Microsoft Azure Active Directory

fields.description:

h4. Workaround

JRASERVER-68724: Trigger Directory Syncs using the REST API contains a bash script that provides an effective workaround for this scenario.
fields.summary: Allow to schedule the user directory synchronisation job

When a user edits a work logged of an issue, the Issue Worklog Updated email does not contain the issue key in the email body.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Graphical workflow editor does not display screens attached to actions for some workflows
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import [^BugtrackWF.xml] as workflow (simple workflow containing two states and a transition using ResolveIssue screen).
 # Switch to {{Diagram}} tab. Click on {{Resolve}} transition between {{Open}} and {{Resolved}} states. Notice that no screen information is presented
 !step1.png|thumbnail!
 # Switch to {{Text}} tab. Notice that {{Resolve Issue Screen}} is displayed
 !step2.png|thumbnail!
 # Click {{Edit}}, and click {{Update}} on {{Update Workflow Transition}} page, without making any changes
 !step3.png|thumbnail!
 # Switch to {{Diagram}} tab. Click on {{Resolve}} transition between {{Open}} and {{Resolved}} states. Notice that {{Resolve Issue Screen}} is displayed now

h3. Expected Results

Screen shall also be displayed without updating the workflow, i.e. at step 2 above
h3. Actual Results

Screen is not displayed until an update.
h3. Notes

The update operation, even if no changes are made, causes a structural change in XML representation of workflow, changing action definitions of form below
{noformat}
<action id="5" name="Resolve Issue" view="resolveissue">
                        <meta name="opsbar-sequence">40</meta>
                        <meta name="jira.i18n.submit">resolveissue.resolve</meta>
                        <meta name="jira.i18n.description">resolveissue.desc.line1</meta>
                        <meta name="jira.i18n.title">resolveissue.title</meta>
{noformat}
to below form
{noformat}
<action id="5" name="Resolve Issue" view="fieldscreen">
                        <meta name="opsbar-sequence">40</meta>
                        <meta name="jira.i18n.submit">resolveissue.resolve</meta>
                        <meta name="jira.description"/>
                        <meta name="jira.i18n.description">resolveissue.desc.line1</meta>
                        <meta name="jira.i18n.title">resolveissue.title</meta>
                        <meta name="jira.fieldscreen.id">3</meta>
{noformat}
While latter form is displayed fine in both graphical and text mode, screens are not displayed at graphical mode using first form
h3. Workaround

Update the workflow in text mode
fields.summary: Inconsistency between graphical and text mode workflow editors showing screens attached to actions
Incorrect autoCompleteUrl for Assignee in createmeta REST API call

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Custom Fields UI Page at {{base_url/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa}} [^screenshot-1.png] will not load unless 2 or more language packs are enabled.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Core 7.12.0
* Reproducible on fresh installation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Core 7.12.0
# Create one or more custom fields.
# Navigate to "Manage Add-ons".
# Disable all languages, except *English (United States) Language Pack* [^screenshot-2.png].
# Navigate to Custom Fields UI. 

h3. Expected Results
Custom Fields will load. 

h3. Actual Results
No Custom Fields can be seen. It seems that the page does not complete loading. [^screenshot-1.png]

fields.description:
*Summary*

As an admin I would like to better understand the security implications of having clustered environment. I would like to understand what I should review and what I should change.

[Installing JIRA Data Center version 7.2 documentation |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/installing-jira-data-center-828787580.html] provided the following security note:
{quote}Ensure that only permitted cluster nodes are allowed to connect to a JIRA Data Center instance's ehcache RMI port, which by default is port port 40001, through the use of a firewall and/or network segregation. Not restricting access to the ehcache RMI port could result in the compromise of a JIRA Data Center instance.
{quote}
This note is not present in [new versions of the documentation. |https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/installing-jira-data-center-938846870.html] Currently there is no mention of security.

*Suggested Change*

Create new documentation detailing security considerations when using JIRA Data Center.
 * Another option is documentation that describes security considerations for all Atlassian Data Center applications, including JIRA Data Center.

Example suggested content:
 * Network security considerations
 * File system security considerations
fields.summary: Document security considerations when using JIRA Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The [Troubleshooting application links|https://confluence.atlassian.com/applinks/troubleshoot-application-links-755338283.html] and other versions of that page mention this:
{quote}3. Are you linking Atlassian Cloud applications?
 If an application involved in your application link is hosted on Atlassian Cloud, there are a couple of considerations. Your local server must use a valid SSL certificate, and it *must be accessible on port 80 or 443.*
{quote}
However, we have updated the available ports and now all these ports are available: 80, 443, 7990, 8060, 8080, 8085, 8090 and 8443.

This has already been updated in [Functional differences in Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/restricted-functions-in-atlassian-cloud-apps-744721664.html] and similar text can be used (or maybe just a link to the page).

This needs updating on '[Troubleshooting application links' |https://confluence.atlassian.com/applinks/troubleshoot-application-links-755338283.html]page and probably other versions of it.
h3. Suggested Solution

Do either of 2 solutions:
 # Change text to:
{quote}3. Are you linking Atlassian Cloud applications?
 If an application involved in your application link is hosted on Atlassian Cloud, there are a couple of considerations. Your local server must use a valid SSL certificate, and it must be accessible on one of these ports: 80, 443, 7990, 8060, 8080, 8085, 8090 or 8443.
{quote}
 # Link to [Functional differences in Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/restricted-functions-in-atlassian-cloud-apps-744721664.html] so we don't need to keep changing in two places when this is changes. Something like this:
{quote}3. Are you linking Atlassian Cloud applications?
 If an application involved in your application link is hosted on Atlassian Cloud, there are a couple of considerations. Your local server must use a valid SSL certificate, and it must be accessible on one of the ports defined on [Functional differences in Atlassian Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/restricted-functions-in-atlassian-cloud-apps-744721664.html] in 'Available ports for connecting to external applications'
{quote}
fields.summary: Application Links documentation update

h3. Summary
When deleting a user, if the user has involved in some issues as assignee and/or reporter, JIRA will display JQL links to those issues. If the username contains a special character, the links do not escape the special character and consequently throw JQL format errors.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user with this username: fake@localhost (@ is a special character in this case, which is common where username is the same as email address)
# Set the user as reporter of 1 issue and assignee of another
# Go to User Management -> Users -> attempt to Delete fake@localhost
# Confirm that JIRA display 2 JQL links as follows:
!deleteuser.png|thumbnail!
# Click the links

h3. Expected behavior
The JQLs work correctly and display the corresponding issues

h3. Actual behavior
JIRA fails to escape the special character and throws a warning:
!jql.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Manually wrap the username inside double quotes and perform the search again e.g.:
{code}reporter in ("fake@localhost") ORDER BY priority ASC{code}
fields.summary: JIRA does not escape special character from username when opening JQLs from Delete User dialog

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Reindexing has fixed/forced 5s pauses between runs. This reduces reindexing throughput (the reindexing thread is sleeping instead of working on the index).

h3. Details
Let’s assume your node has a reindexing speed of 20 documents per second and that the DC cluster produces 20 reindex requests per second.
Theoretically, the cluster is at peak capacity, but nothing bad happens (there should be no backlog).
But practically, what happens is:
# At t0, the node wakes up, checks the db and finds no documents to reindex. It sleeps for 5 seconds.
# At t0+5s, the node wakes up and finds 100 documents to reindex. It does it (5 seconds passes, while 100 new reindex requests gets queued) and goes to sleep for 5 seconds (another 100 new reindex requests gets queued).
# At t0+10s, the node wakes up and finds 200 documents to reindex. It does it (10 seconds passes, 200 new reindex requests) and goes to sleep for 5 seconds (another 100 requests) gets queued. 
And so on. Every five seconds, the reindex backlog grows (indefinitely).
To enter this infinite backlog scenario, it’s enough if the per node reindex time exceeds 2.5s (per batch).

h3. Note on fix
The delay is not fixed anymore, chosen adaptively in <0s;5s> range.

h3. Workaround:
None. Upgrade Jira to one of the fixed versions
fields.summary: DC node reindex is run in 5s intervals instead of load-dependent intervals

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When JIRA DVCS connector is performing a long synchronisation from Bitbucket Cloud, memcache from Bitbucket side is expiring and JIRA DVCS connector does not re-establish the connection and will failed the sync process

h3. Environment
* JIRA Software with DVCS connector 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In JIRA Software, link Bitbucket Cloud under the DVCS account configuration
# JIRA will then add the corresponding repository
# Under certain circumstances, sometimes JIRA will failed to perform the synchronisation due to network issue or some other factor

h3. Expected Results
JIRA DVCS connector should be able aware of the memcache is expiring and try to re-establish a reconnection

h3. Actual Results
JIRA DVCS connector is not aware of the memcache expiring and failed to re-establish a reconnection and following error occurred:
{code}
2018-08-31 11:20:38,363 DVCSConnector.MessageExecutor:thread-15 ERROR ServiceRunner     [c.a.j.p.d.service.message.MessageConsumer] Synchronization failed: {"type": "error", "error": {"message": "Traversal state lost. Unable to resume."}} (Sentry: N/A)
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.bitbucket.clientlibrary.request.BitbucketRequestException$InternalServerError_500: {"type": "error", "error": {"message": "Traversal state lost. Unable to resume."}} (Sentry: N/A)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.bitbucket.clientlibrary.request.BaseRemoteRequestor.checkAndCreateRemoteResponse(BaseRemoteRequestor.java:270)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.bitbucket.clientlibrary.request.BaseRemoteRequestor.request(BaseRemoteRequestor.java:226)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.bitbucket.clientlibrary.request.BaseRemoteRequestor.requestWithoutPayload(BaseRemoteRequestor.java:210)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.bitbucket.clientlibrary.request.BaseRemoteRequestor.lambda$getWithRetry$0(BaseRemoteRequestor.java:131)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.bitbucket.clientlibrary.client.BadRequestRetryer.retry(BadRequestRetryer.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.dvcs.spi.bitbucket.clientlibrary.client.BadRequestRetryer.retry(BadRequestRetryer.java:20)
{code}
 
h3. Notes
This behaviour is only reproducible when JIRA failed to perform the sync from the repository after a certain long interval

h3.Workaround
Removing the affected repository and then perform the sync one more time
fields.summary: JIRA DVCS does not re-establish the sync connection if memcache is expiring from Bitbucket Cloud side

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

The existing filter search in the External Filter Result gadget is not user-friendly, it will only show at most 10 results when you were typing the filter name. Let's say if you search for 'AA' and the filter intended is not returned among the 10 results, you will be required to continue to type until it shows up and sometimes you will need to type the full name of the filter name. 

h3. *Suggested Solution*

Add the Advanced Search feature like what we have in the local Filter Result gadget. Otherwise, we can also add a feature to allow users to search by FIlter ID. 

h3. *Why this is important* 

Let's say we have several JIRA instances that are working together and the external Filter Result gadget become exceptionally important for users to retrieve or display the data from every other connected JIRA instances. 

Therefore, the Advanced Search is really a helpful feature that will greatly reduce the search time needed. 

In addition to that, since we have multiple JIRA instances connected, it is expected that we will have a large number of filters that have a similar prefix name. In this case, if we search by filter ID, we can avoid search result that is not relevant. Instead, we will only be returned with the filter from each JIRA instances that have that filter ID and the possibility of duplication can be very minimal here. 

h3. *Workaround*

Type the full name of the filter name in order to find the filter.
fields.summary: Add advanced search and search by Filter ID in the External Filter Result gadget

fields.description:
When performing a re-index in Jira Data Center the completed re-index on one node will be replicated by index snapshots to the other nodes

This request is to provide a REST endpoint in order to monitor the index snapshot restore operation on the other nodes as this process can take a few hours in larger environments if a lot of changes are made in short amount of time.

As a workaround administrators can monitor the application logs for the following sequence of events. In this example node 2 has completed a re-index and node 1's logs are as follows:
{code}
jira1 | 2018-09-05 20:33:13,366 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultNodeReindexService] Re-index after last sync detected: operationName=FULL_REINDEX_END, sourceNodeId=jira2, indexTime=2018-09-05 20:33:12.357. Resetting index count and restoring index from backupFilename='IndexSnapshot_10103.zip'
jira1 | 2018-09-05 20:33:13,372 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index restore started. Snapshot file: IndexSnapshot_10103.zip
jira1 | 2018-09-05 20:33:14,287 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Restoring search indexes - 1% complete... Replacing indexes
jira1 | 2018-09-05 20:33:14,401 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Re-index start time: {2018-09-05 20:29:26.297}, Latest DB date: {2018-09-05 03:17:35.207}
jira1 | 2018-09-05 20:33:14,401 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Restoring search indexes - 20% complete... Restored index backup
jira1 | 2018-09-05 20:33:14,779 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Recovering search indexes - 60% complete... Recovered added and updated issues
jira1 | 2018-09-05 20:33:14,809 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Recovering search indexes - 80% complete... Cleaned removed issues
jira1 | 2018-09-05 20:33:14,843 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexRecoveryManager] Recovering search indexes - 100% complete... Recovered all indexes
jira1 | 2018-09-05 20:33:14,847 NodeReindexServiceThread:thread-1 INFO      [c.a.j.index.ha.DefaultIndexCopyService] Index restore complete
{code}
fields.summary: Monitor index snapshot restore progress via REST API

fields.description:
h3. Description
When you convert an issue from a completed Sprint into a subtask of a ticket that is in a different Sprint, the issue is moved to the parent's Sprint but there is no record of this change on the Activity Tab.

h3. How to reproduce

1) Create two sprints, Sprint 1 and Sprint 2, and assign Issue 1, 2 and 3 to Sprint 1, and Issue 4, 5 and 6 to Sprint 2
2) Complete Sprint 1.
3) Convert, let's say, Issue 2, which was part of the completed Sprint 1, to be a subtask of Issue 5, from Sprint 2. The change is successful, and Issue 2 should be now a subtask of it's parent Issue 5, and also part of Sprint 2.
4) There is no records on the history tab of the issue of this sprint change.
fields.summary: Show on the Activity Tab when an issue is moved to a different sprint when it is converted to a subtask

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an admin, when I use the JIRA Unattended installation/upgrade, it automatically starts Jira. I do not want this because I need to further copy over my customisations(for example certificates) before Jira is started up. 
Since this is the case, I would like to have an option that only sets up the instance but does not start it up.

h3. Suggested Solution
I would like to have the option to configure response.varfile in such a way that it does not start Jira after installation is finished.

h3. Workaround
In Windows, we have noticed that when setting the following parameters to false, it does not start JIRA : 
{noformat}launch.application$Boolean=true
executeLauncherAction$Boolean=true{noformat}
This option does not work on Unix though :(
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin, I would like to have the functionality to not have Jira started after unattended installation/upgrade

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the same license for JIRA and be applied in multiple JIRA instances. By design, license activation for Atlassian product does not require the application to contact any of Atlassian server. This allows the full offline activation for Atlassian products.

Some organisation would like a way to track the number of times a license is applied in Atlassian application to prevent employees from applying for the license in unauthorised instances.


h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option way (based on Server ID) to track all the JIRA instances which have the license owned by a specific organisation.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Provide a way to track license activation
